result.execSummary:
The defendant Timmy Lee Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$14,818.55 represents restitution plus $1,481.86 restitution surcharge.  Joint and Several.
Pursuant to Restitution Order (DOC-31) dated 08/29/2016, $12,318.55 represents restitution plus $1,481.86 restitution surcharge.  Co-defendant in 15CF314 had a cash bond posted, $2,500, that was applied to restitution.

Per Court order on 1/10/2022, Defendant is to serve 30 day sanction. May be served in Barron County if at no cost to Chippewa County. Huber and electronic monitoring granted for work release. Defendant to report by 5:00pm on 1/10/2022.

Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    $250 represents DNA surcharge.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Not to possess any dangerous weapons.  
Not to possess or consume any alcohol. 
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.  
Not to possess or consume any controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel.  
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  
Not to associate with anyone using, possessing or distributing illegal drugs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timmy Lee Johnson

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Timmy Lee Johnson in court.  Attorney Wade Newell in court for State of Wisconsin. DOC agent K. Lundequam appears. 
Court states case and notes appearances. 
Court reviews restitution payment history.
Agent Lundequam outlines payments since previous hearing. 
Defendant outlines employment & child's medical issues.
DA Newell requests wage assignment.
Agent indicates that defendant has been in contact with her and keeps her updated but has requested consistent payments toward restitution. 
Court orders defendant enter into a wage assignment between his employer and DOC , wage assignment to remain in effect until the obligation is paid. Defendant is to be notified within 10 days of any employment change, wage assignment to be put in place with any further employers. In the event of unemployment to complete 5 job seeks per week.
Defendant believes he would be able to afford $150 payment per biweekly pay period. 
Court orders $150 per paycheck be included in wage assignment.

11:05 AM Defendant Timmy Lee Johnson in court.  Wade Newell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Timmy Lee Johnson appeared by video means. Agent Lundequam appeared by video means. 
Agent Lundequam informs the Court on 1/7/2022 Defendant paid $320 towards restitution. 
Defendant makes statement to the Court regarding payment progress. 
DA Newell makes statement to the Court. 
Agent Lundequam makes statement to the Court. 
Court orders 30 day sanction in jail w/ Huber or Electronic Monitoring. May be served in Barron County if at no cost to Chippewa County. 
Report by 5:00pm today, 1/10/2022, either at Barron County or Chippewa County jail. 
DA Newell requests probation review hearing in April of 2022. 
Defendant to appear in person or to make arrangements to appear in the alternative before next court date.  Probation review hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Probation review hearing on January 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Filed by DOC Agent Lundequam, RE: Restitution payments - sent for review
DOC Offender Payment History
DOC Financial Balance Inqiury
From DOC Agent Lundequam, RE: Medical Documentation *Sent for review*

09:33 AM Defendant Timmy Lee Johnson in court without counsel.  Wade Newell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC Agent, Kara Lundequam appeared in court.  
DA Newell states hrg. is due to lack of payment of restitution. 
Court states restitution owed from 5/26/2021 letter of $ 11,087.30 plus $ 1,999.86 court obligations.
DOC agent states $300.00 of payments have been made since extension.
Court asks Defendant why he hasn't been able to pay.  Defendant responds.
DA Newell requests defendant submit proof of colon being removed to the Court and potentially extend order. 
Court orders defendant to provide proof to agent within 20 days:
1) That surgery was necessary and it occurred.
2) Court to extend Order another 12 months & wants to see progress with at least $ 5,000.00 paid in a year.
If no progress made in December; Court imposes an additional 30 days of conditional jail time if no progress made; additional sanctions may come.
Court enters the order.

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on June 14, 2021 at 09:30 am.
from DOC requesting court review of probation (sent for review)
Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations
Extending Probation

03:01 PM Defendant Timmy Lee Johnson in court.  Wade Newell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Timmy Lee Johnson appeared by video means. Agent A.R. appears via Zoom. 
Court addresses unpaid restitution. 
Agent does not feel a good faith effort was made, consistent payments have not been made and recommends an extension of probation. 
DA Newell requests probation be extended for 12 months with $50 payments being made monthly during that duration and the remaining balance be converted to civil judgment. 
Court orders: probation be extended for a period of 12 months - monthly payments to be made as determined to be fair and reasonable by agent. Case to be reviewed in 12 months for civil judgment.
